bibl.note: This is a letter from John Montgomery to his brother Daniel, dated November 23, 1844. John is asking Daniel to send him some money. John also mentions Polk winning the presidential election.

div1.p: If you have not yet forwarded the fifty dollars I wish you to send it to me by Mr Huddleston who informs me he is going up that way.
We are all in high spirits as to the election believing that Polk is the President if he has not got Tennessee

closer.add:
Brother John
I receive yours last note by Mr Huddleston
